page.title: 14Local History-Witton
page.content: {Prehistoric Sites}-Witton. Since 1960 many artefacts have been found by field walking on a local farmer's land.An account is in "The Archaeology of Witton" published by the Norfolk Archaeological Unit. {Historic Houses}Witton Old Hall dates in part back to the 14th century though now pocessing a 17th century facade.The ruins of Witton Hall built in 1777 for the Earl of Kimberley & demolished in 1927 can be seen in the grounds of the present hall.Cellars have been turned into a sunken garden by the owners.Hoole House,Witton,a former poor house that was left to the parish of Witton by Richard Drake in 1649,is now a private dwelling having been sold & money from sale invested by the Charity Commissioners.Dividends are used to help needy residents living in rented accomodation.
